thread.title: Park Rangers to lead hike in Damascus Forest
thread.title_full: Park Rangers to lead hike in Damascus Forest

title: Park Rangers to lead hike in Damascus Forest
text: Park Rangers to lead hike in Damascus Forest Comment Posted Jul. 16, 2015 at 7:02 PM Posted Jul. 16, 2015 at 7:02 PM DAMASCUS - On Sunday, July 19 at 10:30 a.m. Park Rangers from the Upper Delaware Scenic and Recreational River will lead a hike on the Damascus Forest Trail near Beach Lake. The hike will include instruction on the basics of nature photography, featuring native birds that inhabit the Damascus Forest. The two mile trail loop is rated as easy; making the program perfect for hikers and photographers of any skill level. Park staff will lead participants on an educational and instructional tour of the trail, focusing on the diverse array of birds that will be flying overhead as the hike unfolds. The trail itself features wetlands and old growth forests, including a beautiful stand of old growth hemlocks. The Damascus Trail is one of the six trails featured in the “Take a Hike!” program. The six trails in the Delaware River Valley are rated by difficulty and length, and are a perfect way to get out and experience a National Park nearby. Folks who complete all six hikes and receive a “Take a Hike!” patch. In 2015, ranger-led programs will take place on five of the six “Take a Hike!” trails between July and September. Information on the programs and the “Take a Hike!” program overall can be found on the park website at www.nps.gov/upde. Hiking information and the schedule of park events can also be obtained by calling 570-685-4871 or by visiting the Zane Grey Museum in Lackawaxen, or at one of the Park Service information kiosks located at the river accesses by Skinners Falls, Ten Mile River, Lackawaxen or Mongaup. The free hike is open to the public, and will begin at 10:30 a.m. on the Damascus Forest Trail head.To get to the trail, turn onto River Road from PA Route 652 (near the Narrowsburg Bridge). Turn left on MacCubbins Road, and travel six tenths of a mile. The parking lot is on the right hand side. The GPS coordinates are 413808.4 – 750343.8. The trail is two miles long and should last around two hours, so bring sturdy hiking shoes, pack plenty of water, bring snacks and bug spray. For more information call 570-685-4871, visit www.nps.gov/upde, or follow the Upper Delaware Scenic and Recreation River on Facebook at www.facebook.com/updeNPS or https://instagram.com/UpperDelawareNPS. News Eagle - Hawley, PA
